website_summaries.verdict: A luxurious wireless speaker with good sound and amazing design in a compact size, but it's not cheap.
pros: The Naim mu-so Qb is impeccably designed and looks every inch a $1,000 speaker
The Qb sounds great for a product of its impossibly compact dimensions
The number of inputs it offers is obscenely good
cons: Equivalent performance can be had with the Sonos Play:5 for half the price, and other high-end speakers can offer bigger, stereo sound
The app is nowhere as slick, capable or easy to use as Sonos'

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, but get the remote control too!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I would highly recommend it as the sound is awesome for an 8-inch cube speaker and it has great features such as Internet radio which you can set to your favorite station and it'll come on automatically every time you turn it on. Also it works very well with Tidal and Spotify streaming services. I use it as a TV speaker for my LG short throw projector as well, and it's a real space saving combination. If it were possible I would deduct half a star for not including the remote control which you can buy separately. Sure, you can use the app instead but the remote should be included at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Know where and what to listen before buying
customer_reviews.text: I am a average Spotify type music listener. The sound is great, powerful, very easy to connect Bluetooth. The unique “box “design is perfect. But I was disappointed and upset at the first. For the high price, I expected premium sound, at least should be better than my $399 Energy sound bar. Wait, this is just one BOX with built in speakers. No way to compare with home theater with multi speaker system. Once I realized this key point, I start enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: T. smith

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Wireless Music System
customer_reviews.text: Wow... Naim really does produce outstanding audio gear. The equipment is expensive, but it is reliable and very easy to use. The build quality is excellent, too. Wireless connectivity is solid; no drops or losses. The unit's ability to decode today's hi-def audio formats is first-rate. Highly recommended (by an audiophile).
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Small in size, but big and clear in sound.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing you will notice is how good this speaker looks. It can become a conversation piece on just that. Once you stream music through it, you will find that it sound twice as good as it looks. It will fill up a room with sound, but with a clarity that will surprise (and impress) you. Particularly with lossless music, with is readily available (through 3 month subscription to TIDAL music service). Unless you are a true audiophile with the means to purchase the high end speakers to support your taste, I doubt that you have a speaker in your home that has realistic sound that the Mu So Qb gives.
customer_reviews.author: S Mas

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Connectivity Inconsistent, Cuts out A lot.........
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of the position of my music source, cell phone, computer, etc. I cannot get a consistent bluetooth connection with the Muso. The music keeps cutting out and it seems to be on a time rhythm that is consistent. About 25 sec on and then it cuts out for about the same. For this price, I'm very disappointed, not sure if its a design flaw or a cheap bluetooth receiver but I'm sorry I bought this product. When its functioning, the sound quality is good for a single source audio speaker, but not impressive. I have an old Bose Sound that would kill this thing in audio quality. A waste of money.......
customer_reviews.author: Heavy Horse

customer_reviews.title: Mu-So Wireless Speaker
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an Airplay device, playing music files through iTunes and to play audio from the TV. I own several other wireless, Airplay/Bluetooth speakers, and enjoy them all; but the Mu-So takes the experience to another level. It's not an audiophile system costing several thousand dollars, but it excels at what it's designed to do. Visually, the design is aesthetically pleasing, and the DAC (digital audio converter) is top notch. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: The Digital Imager

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile In A Box
customer_reviews.text: The sound is wonderful for its size. Unlike impressive noise from a small enclosure this has a quality sound from a small enclosure. I have owned complete Naim systems in the past and have never been disappointed. It may not seem like it but the price is very low considering it is a Naim product. This is a true audiophile component.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D Ford

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity problems
customer_reviews.text: When this works, it's a lovely speaker. But it rarely does. I've had it only a few months, and it has had numerous connectivity problems. Setup is fine, but I would have expected a more stable connection from a high end speaker. My more more affordable Riva, on the same network, further from the router, works just fine, all the time.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: App support is abysmal
customer_reviews.text: Naim make good quality hardware but the software app that are supposed to support it is truly abysmal and mostly unusable. Reviewers of both iOS and Android versions have been complaining for years about this, but nothing ever seems to improve. I have reached the point where if I see the message "searching for rooms" one more time I will throw myself off a cliff. Time to move on and find a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Whittet

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful top-end, bumping low-end.
customer_reviews.text: This was the full sound system for my wedding, which was a small venue. This system was able to handle really delicate songs with stunning clarity, and then when the time came, it was able to fill the space with Beyonce for the dancing. PROS: -Beautiful sound and clarity. -Awesome compact design. -Super mobile. -It's a visually stunning piece that displays well. CONS: -The button to activate the pairing is a pinhole, so you have to have a special tool to click it. Seems over-engineered. -Pricey, but with speakers, it's buy nice or buy twice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I never review items but had to say something. This is the perfect Hi-Fi system for small spaces, like apartments. It fills the room with amazing sound even at low volume, so you don’t have to sacrifice a fantastic listening experience when you don’t want the neighbors to shush you.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya Tulei

customer_reviews.title: Stunning Wireless Music System
customer_reviews.text: The Naim Mu-So Qb pushes the limits of physics for box this size. Plays very loud with minimal distortion. It is beautifully designed and very well made. Not inexpensive, but probably the best "portable" wireless player on the market in the $1,000 and under category. Highly recommended if you appreciate sublime industrial design and are willing to pay for superior sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: RCL

customer_reviews.title: Awful Bluetooth and App Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: If you intend to use this device using a hardwired connection, then the sound quality and usability is okay given the price. But if you plan to use the streaming options, then this thing is garbage. It constantly disconnects during playback and the only way to reset it is to unplug it from the wall and then hope that that worked out the bugs, temporarily. NAIM should be ashamed that their wireless connectivity is not even on par with a $100 UE device.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Good sounding all in one package. The highs and midrange aren't as defined as on the Martin Logan Crescendo but it more than makes up for that lack by having a "thumpier" low end. Very small footprint and impressive big, not overly processed, sound.
customer_reviews.author: icondaly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect system for my office
customer_reviews.text: This works great with my predominantly Apple household. Sound is about what I expected for a relatively cheap Naim system, connectivity is great.
customer_reviews.author: Granite State

customer_reviews.title: All that and so much more.
customer_reviews.text: Super impressive and modern right out of the box. It did take a bit just to figure the thing out. Great things take time, I guess. This unit replaces the sonos / play 1's / sub & connect which sounded amazing for that ten minutes a month when it decided to function. No issues at all with this streamlined piece of art that happens to sound great.
customer_reviews.author: lance siegel

customer_reviews.title: No Additional Shipping Charge, Fantastic Selling Price, Prompt Delivery
customer_reviews.text: World Class Audio Product from the Leader High-End Audio Equipment, On-line support from the manufacture cannot be beat and I own 10's of $1000.00 of audio equipment from the best companies all over the world. This was a present to my Mother for Christmas & her birthday!
customer_reviews.author: Tomodachi

customer_reviews.title: Compact delight
customer_reviews.text: I listen to music from my iPod in the bathroom. This brings solid sound with great bass from a compact footprint. Using the USB cable avoids the distortion and dropouts of a Bluetooth connection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy into the hype, this is not high end audio.
customer_reviews.text: I am so dissatisfied with this speaker it's disgusting. The Sound quality is so poor, my UE meagaboom sounds better. No volume control on the phone app, remote is worthless 10 feet away, and bluetooth drops at around 15 feet. I am returning same day it arrived. What a complete disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Steppenwolfe

customer_reviews.title: Another nice unit from Naim.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, excellent app and outstanding sound quality. Naim is known for producing components with uncompromising performance, and that is exactly what you get will from both wireless speaker offerings from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied all in one speaker
customer_reviews.text: Pros: naim’s value, sound quality, power, design etc Cons: nothing but a little bit white noise that u gonna try to listen it beside muso.
customer_reviews.author: Yeonghak

customer_reviews.title: It’s Naim
customer_reviews.text: Good design. Looks beautiful. Sounds really good as a small Bluetooth speaker. It’s not HiFi. But is good for background music. Especially for listening the internet radio. Easy to control with iPhone App. I’ll buy more for the other room. Great Naim!
customer_reviews.author: Hai Lin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speaker
customer_reviews.text: Best ever wireless speaker I ever owned. Very easy to setup. Sound quality is superb compared to sonos and bose.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopperSince2004

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: style and sound....I'm a new fan of Naim, no problem with the Iphone app to manage the unit...JJC
customer_reviews.author: JOHN C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and quality device.
customer_reviews.text: I bought Mu-So Qb about few days ago,and I like it. This is wonderful music system, great sound and features. I Am completely happy. Amazing device. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bels Yackov

customer_reviews.title: Seller send me a used speaker!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I received the speaker I found there is many finger print and scratches on the remote control and the touch pad also the speaker‘s edges has been bumped. I’m very disappointed to the seller.
customer_reviews.author: zi xin MAO

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Can't use it in stereo.  Naim should be ashamed of their software.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is very clear. The phone app is horrible. They should provide the remote instead of requiring you to track down someplace that sells it in the US. You really should be able to use a pair in stereo.
customer_reviews.author: A. Josephs

customer_reviews.title: The Naim Muso makes me happy. I'll be purchasing another along with an xb ...
customer_reviews.text: I have spent thousands on Amazon and this is my first review. The Naim Muso makes me happy. I'll be purchasing another along with an xb for my other rooms in my urban lair. Thank you Naim!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the absolute best purchases I have made
customer_reviews.text: One of the absolute best purchases I have made. Worth every flipping penny. The music is just incredible. The sound quality is beyond. I had a Zeppelin, and that does not even compare to this. App is great and now they have an alarm clock. I sometimes play a spotify ocean waves list to go to sleep. If you have the money, great great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Mathew V.

customer_reviews.title: Love the design
customer_reviews.text: Love the design, the sound, the radio ... but some problem with the recognition of my devices ... software should be updated otherwise it's a great product !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: One of the best music systems...!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing music system one of the best I have owned bar none ❤️🙌🏽
customer_reviews.author: Rabih Chatila

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, speaker is ok
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, speaker is ok, but lots of connectivity issues plague this device. Spotify app does not work quite right (radio function stops playing and does not load new songs). For something this expensive we expected more. Hopefully a firmware upgrade will be forthcoming.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: It is by far my favorite stand alone speaker in the price range
customer_reviews.text: If you want to read my thoughts and comparisons of all of the speakers I tested during my journey to find a stand alone, wireless speaker look up the B&O A6. It is by far my favorite stand alone speaker in the price range. The Mu-So was ok, but for $500 less the B&O A6 will give you a better front to back sound stage, just as open and transparent a presentation, a slightly better midrange, better base response, and will stream 24/192 files with no hiccups. However, the Mu-So was the second best speaker I tested. For some, it may even come out on top. Just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R Holstein

customer_reviews.title: Defective on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Arrived not working - no Bluetooth connectivity and damaged audio jack, device not recognised by NAIM app
customer_reviews.author: Damion J Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: what can be better? I know, but this is a great substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kates

customer_reviews.title: Mu- So. So music.
customer_reviews.text: I am a music zealot, I aim for the greatest music quality that an average family can get. This is the one. This system connects your any device in anyway you can imagine. You can change the color of the form curtain by purchasing additional accessories. Watts enough for your to shake the whole house, Bass feels like someone hit you with a bat. This things is not a match to Bose or Beats On this system I listen to Future Hendrix and it does drop the beat and go hard. I can't even see me.
customer_reviews.author: Yunfei Skye

customer_reviews.title: Perfect unit. I have two Naim Muso units
customer_reviews.text: Perfect unit. I have two Naim Muso units. 1. Sound is very good 2. multi room technology works flawlessly. Nice feature is the integrated web radio interface. 3. Design is quite unique with the wavy front. 4. Shipment & packaging: easy and in time, good protected but no packaging overkill Summary: Plug it in & enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Christoph Werner

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know. Highs were high...clear as a bell. LOWs on the other hand where a bit flat. Bass was shallow and confined to the area where the unit was placed. The unit looks amazing but the B&W A7 is still the one to beat.
customer_reviews.author: My 2 cents...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome system. The sound quality is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truly stunning hi-fi sound
customer_reviews.text: Stunning audio from every corner of the room. A worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Burke

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality and great service from order to delivery!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  Wow.  Wow
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable sound quality. In fact blows me away and I own 3500 dollar speakers on my main system
customer_reviews.author: Michael Graff

customer_reviews.title: Should have better out going inspection
customer_reviews.text: Items were missing in the package. Should have better out going inspection, especially for how expensive this item is.
customer_reviews.author: K L

customer_reviews.title: Failed to power on- Don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived looking all sleek and nice Failed to power on. I plugged in the power cord connection ed it to a working socket and NOTHING Tried multiple sockets ...NO LIGHTS NO POWER ......DEAD ON ARRIVAL Such a massive disappointment. Called Amazon , tried trouble shooting . Concluded it was a defective product from the factory Amazon arranging a pick up to ship back in the morning It looked good but it is a defective product and I will not be buying anything from then again. MAJOR DISSATISFACTION - MAJOR DISSAPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.author: Jide

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is good but not the best. Base is not enough comparing to other speakers at lower price.
customer_reviews.author: joseph k

customer_reviews.title: System does not have good sound at all
customer_reviews.text: System does not have good sound at all. Poor mids. Sounds OK if I'm right in front of it, but in the rest of the room the sound is flat. Even tested using lossless audio files and digital optical connection. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Komon

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's nearly impossible to get this Naim to set-up with bluetooth to my computer, phone and/or tv unless they are in the same room that the niam is. Plus my modem is just in the next room about 10feet away and when I play music it cuts in and out. My Boise was way cheaper than this and no problem at all getting connected and staying connect where ever I was in the house or even the yard. Yes it sounds wonderful but not if you can't get it to connect. I wouldn't buy this again or recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works very well!!! The sound es pretty clear of each instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Galvez Lopez

product_meta.title: Naim Mu-so Qb Multi-Room Wireless Music System (Black)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:Mu-so Qb V1300 Watts of Power, Brilliant Sound, Multi-Room Capability: Product of the Year Award-Winning Naim Mu-so Qb Compact Wireless Music System Streams 24-Bit/192kHz, Plays Bluetooth aptX, TIDAL, Spotify, Apple AirPlay, More Measuring a petite 8.3 x 8.6 x 8.3 inches, touting 300 watts of power, and featuring multi-room capability, the sleek Naim Mu-so Qb is the new champion of compact wireless music systems . Taking many cues from the larger Mu-so , this mini but mighty marvel connects to your home Wi-Fi network and gives you immediate access to Apple AirPlay, Spotify, TIDAL, and Internet radio. Universal Plug 'n' Play allows you to stream music from your computer or network-attached storage in high-resolution 24-bit/192kHz audio. Bluetooth aptX, a USB input, and an analog input further expand your listening options. Want whole-house audio? Done. Mu-so Qb syncs with other Mu-so Qb devices as well as Mu-so to play the same audio in up to five rooms. Control it all from your smartphone via the intuitive Naim app or use the modern touchscreen interface complete with a patent-pending illumination system. Mu-so Qb 's most impressive aspect, however, relates to the rich, vibrant, audiophile-caliber sound delivered by the innovative components housed inside its super-compact cabinet. “Thanks to 300 watts of power on tap, don’t let the diminutive footprint fool you – the Qb kicks major ass, and thanks to onboard DSP, you can play anything. And you can play it loud.” — TONEAudio , Product of the Year Award In Mu-so Qb , five drivers are offset and perfectly angled to create left-right dispersion asymmetry. Two microfiber dome tweeters, two midrange drivers with rare-earth magnets and copper poles, and the combination of two passive bass radiators and a custom-designed woofer fueled by a 100W amplifier produce staggering clarity, depth, and
feature_bullets: Plays Bluetooth aptX, TIDAL, Spotify, Apple AirPlay, More
Measuring a petite 8.3 x 8.6 x 8.3 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars134 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
